longBusinessSummary: Takamiya Co., Ltd. engages in the rental of temporary construction equipment in Japan and internationally. It operates through Platform Business, Business of Selling, Rental Business, and Overseas Business segments. The company leases scaffolding, frame-related and common components, hanging shelf scaffolding, shoring and beam, hyper series, standing bear, and NETIS products; sells scaffolding/shoring systems, frame scaffolding and temporary products, formwork and civil engineering products, soundproofing products, and NETIX products; and develops and manufactures external scaffolding materials, shoring materials, suspended scaffolding materials, formwork materials, and safety curing materials. It also operates OPERA, a platform portal for ordering temporary equipment for rental. In addition, the company offers residential building materials, such as WUTEC and MUSASABI vibration control devices that reduce the shaking amplitude of homes; structural equipment comprising elslit, and captain and capping pile methods; agricultural materials consisting of steel frame and pipe houses, SustagramFarm agricultural system package, and natural fossil coral fertilizers; Tiger Dam, a water-bag type inflatable dam system for flood prevention; bridge materials, including archist one piece-gel systems; POGERO and POGERO-C solar carports; and solar panel mounting frame systems. Further, it provides construction; in-house CAD drawing and strength calculations for scaffolding; assembly and disassembly of scaffolding; scaffolding and safety hygiene educational workshops; and scaffolding safety consulting services. The company serves construction and remodeling companies. The company was formerly known as SRG Takamiya Co., Ltd. and changed its name to Takamiya Co., Ltd. in April 2019. The company was incorporated in 1969 and is headquartered in Osaka, Japan.
